name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
details: A novel set in the 1920s about the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
details: A story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

author: George Orwell
details: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control its citizens.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
details: A romantic novel that also critiques the British class system of the early 19th century.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
details: A novel about teenage rebellion and alienation, narrated by the iconic Holden Caulfield.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
details: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to win a share of a treasure guarded by a dragon.

name: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
details: A novel about the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab to hunt the white whale Moby Dick.

name: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
details: A historical novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and its impact on Tsarist society.

name: The Odyssey
author: Homer
details: An epic poem about the adventures of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

name: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
details: A psychological novel about the moral dilemmas faced by a young man who commits a murder.
